Reticular Action Model (\(\boldsymbol{\Sigma}\) or \(\mathbf{S}\))

Source: R/ram.R
ram_S.Rd

Model-implied variance-covariance matrix (\(\boldsymbol{\Sigma} \left( \boldsymbol{\theta} \right)\)) or \(\mathbf{S}\) Matrix using the Reticular Action Model notation.

ram_S(A, sigma2, F, I, SigmaMatrix = TRUE)

Arguments

A

Asymmetric paths, such as regression coefficients and factor loadings.
sigma2

Vector of variances (\(\sigma^2\)).
F

Filter matrix used to select the observed variables.
I

Identity matrix.
SigmaMatrix

Logical. If TRUE, returns the model-implied variance-covariance matrix (\(\boldsymbol{\Sigma} \left( \boldsymbol{\theta} \right)\)). If FALSE, returns the \(\mathbf{S}\) matrix.

Value

Returns the model-implied variance-covariance matrix (\(\boldsymbol{\Sigma} \left( \boldsymbol{\theta} \right)\)) or the \(\mathbf{S}\) matrix derived from the \(\mathbf{A}\) matrix and \(\sigma^2\) vector.

Details

Derives the model-implied variance-covariance matrix (\(\boldsymbol{\Sigma} \left( \boldsymbol{\theta} \right)\)) or the \(\mathbf{S}\) matrix from the \(\mathbf{A}\) matrix and sigma squared (\(\sigma^2\)) vector (variances). Note that the first element in the matrix should be an exogenous variable.

References

McArdle, J. J. (2013). The development of the RAM rules for latent variable structural equation modeling. In A. Maydeu-Olivares & J. J. McArdle (Eds.), Contemporary Psychometrics: A festschrift for Roderick P. McDonald (pp. 225--273). Lawrence Erlbaum Associates.

McArdle, J. J., & McDonald, R. P. (1984). Some algebraic properties of the Reticular Action Model for moment structures. British Journal of Mathematical and Statistical Psychology, 37(2), 234--251.

See also

Other SEM notation functions: ram_M(), ram_Sigmatheta(), ram_mutheta()

Examples

A <- matrix(
  data = c(
    0, 0.26^(1 / 2), 0,
    0, 0, 0.26^(1 / 2),
    0, 0, 0
  ),
  ncol = 3
)
sigma2 <- c(15^2, 15^2, 15^2)
F <- I <- diag(3)
# Returns the model-implied variance-covariance matrix
ram_S(A = A, sigma2 = sigma2, F = F, I = I, SigmaMatrix = TRUE)
#>          [,1]     [,2]     [,3]
#> [1,] 225.0000 114.7279  58.5000
#> [2,] 114.7279 225.0000 114.7279
#> [3,]  58.5000 114.7279 225.0000
# Returns the model-implied S matrix
ram_S(A = A, sigma2 = sigma2, F = F, I = I, SigmaMatrix = FALSE)
#>      [,1]  [,2]  [,3]
#> [1,]  225   0.0   0.0
#> [2,]    0 166.5   0.0
#> [3,]    0   0.0 166.5
